page.title: 11Child Poverty.
page.content: I like living in Ashton because there are lots of interesting things to do. The trouble is these things cost money and when you are 11 like me you don't have much money. I get Â£1.50 spends a week but from this I have to look after my rabbit. It costs 20p for food which isn't too bad, but if I buy hay it costs 70p and then I dont have much left. The baths cost 35p so I go most weeks, but roller skating costs 95p so I don't go often. If it were cheaper lots of children would go and I'm sure they would get more money because we always buy drinks and crisps. When the fair comes it's the same. They charge high prices, as if adults are paying. There should be lower prices for children everywhere, or the government should pass a law making parents increase spends. Tracey Bancroft. Hurst Knoll.
